humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there is micrometastatic carcinoma in one out of one sentinel lymph node (1/1) in the left axilla. Based on the new rules provided, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. In this pathology report, the sentinel lymph node #1 has micrometastatic carcinoma (1/1), while the other sentinel lymph nodes (#2 and #3) do not have any metastasis (0/1). The presence of micrometastasis in one out of three examined lymph nodes classifies the N stage as N1, according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for breast cancer.
